intro: Corydalis bulbosa f. multicaulis, commonly known as the clustered corydalis, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It features a bulbous root system and produces clusters of delicate, spurred flowers in shades of pink and white. The plant typically blooms in early spring and has lance-shaped, hairy leaves that form a dense rosette. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and prefers partial to full shade. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often grown in rock gardens or woodland settings.
